issue.title: Improve tokenizer usage in MessageController extract action

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  |no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | ?
| Fixed issues  | https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/16828

body: I would like to work on this issue, but I donâ€™t quite know how best to solve this problem. Obviously, I need to add the logic of "looking back", but how to determine exactly that there are no other call parts before? The direct and the most stupid solution is to just check that it's not a static call, but then I can break case with nested calls.
Which "case with nested calls"? Is it covered by tests?
@samdark I added additional test cases and a possible solution to this issue.

After the latest update to 2.0.16, the extractor stopped detecting all messages for translation (using the default call to Yii::t). 

I think this fix has something to do with it, after i commented the changes starting at line [#559](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/5208ef761ed0552d1a4144589b1b7dff4c6fe3e7#diff-c4a5086d29e4d4b9309010d8f4a58e01R559) everything was back to normal.
Would you please create another issue? Thanks.

issue.title: message/extract ignores Yii::t calls when the message is using params returned from method calls
